availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Warner Lewis Underwood (Warren County, KY, attorney and politician)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Virginia native. Married to Lucy C. Underwood. Father of Francis R. Underwood, Juliet B. Underwood, Lucy W. Underwood, Joanna Underwood, Warner Underwood, Henry Underwood, John Underwood, and Mary Underwood. Graduated from the University of Virginia in 1829. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1830. Moved to Texas in 1834 where he served as the attorney general for the district of Eastern Texas. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1848. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1849 to 1853. Member of the United States House of Representatives from 1853 to 1857. Owned twenty-eight enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Warrant for his arrest sent out by the Provisional Government of Kentucky for pro-Union activity in December 1861. Consul in Glasgow, Scotland, for the United States of America from 1862 to September 1864.

ab.bibl:

KYR-0004-033-0021.
